meanings.definition: In a pessimistic or negative manner
meanings.sent1: She looked bearishly at the storm clouds gathering overhead.
meanings.sent2: He spoke bearishly about his chances of winning the game.
meanings.sent3: Despite her bearishly outlook, she couldn't help but smile at the silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The old man shook his head bearishly, convinced that the young generation had lost its way.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's bearishly tone made the students feel uneasy.

meanings.definition: Showing a belief that prices will fall in the financial market
meanings.sent1: The bearishly investor sold his stocks before the market downturn.
meanings.sent2: Her bearishly prediction turned out to be accurate as the stock prices plummeted.
meanings.sent3: The bearishly analyst's forecast made everyone in the office chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The bearishly attitude of the trader was reflected in his cautious investments.
meanings.sent5: The bearishly market conditions made it difficult for new businesses to thrive.
